meanings.definition: A book with a flexible cover, typically made of paper or card.
meanings.sent1: I prefer reading softback books because they are easier to hold.
meanings.sent2: She bought a softback novel to read on her vacation.
meanings.sent3: The softback book whispered stories to the curious reader.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a softback book, open for anyone to explore.
meanings.sent5: The softback cover crinkled as she turned the pages, immersing herself in the story.

meanings.definition: To bind a book with a flexible cover, typically made of paper or card.
meanings.sent1: He learned how to softback his own poetry collection.
meanings.sent2: The author decided to softback the limited edition copies of her book.
meanings.sent3: The librarian softbacked the new arrivals with precision and care.
meanings.sent4: She softbacked the manuscript, sealing the words within the protective cover.
meanings.sent5: Softbacking the journal was the final step before it was ready for display on the shelf.
